title: What is the absolute value equation that has endpoints 13 and 31? - Quora

response.answer_text: To determine the absolute value equation with endpoints 13 and 31 in the form |x-a| =b , first determine the midpoint of 13 and 31. Midpoint of 13 and 31 = 13+31 /2 =44/2 =22. Get the difference between endpoint and the midpoint , 31–22 =0 13–22 =-9 We can say , |x-22| =9
